) Purpose: This IRM is designed to provide the structure needed for effective implementation and operation of telework at the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). Organizations ﬁnding the need for additional guidelines must ensure compliance with the provisions of this policy and fulﬁllment of applicable tiated agreement obligations. (

) Audience: This IRM establishes parameters for using telework at IRS and applies to all Business Operating Units (BODs), bargaining unit (BU) employees, non-bargaining unit (NBU) employees, managers, and For BU employees, where there is a conﬂict in policy between the IRM and National Agreement, the National Agreement prevails. (
) Policy Owner: IRS Human Capital Officer; Director, Worklife, Beneﬁts and Performance Division. (
) Program Owner: Associate Director, Worklife Recognition and Leave Branch; Telework Program Manager. (
) Primary Stakeholders: Information Technology, Workforce Relations Agency-Wide Shared Services and all IRS employees and managers. (

) Program Objectives: To expand telework as technology allows and needs dictate. Telework helps recruit and retain talented employees to serve our taxpayers. Telework enhances work-life balance and supports Continuity Operations (COOP). (
) The Telework Enhancement Act of
(Public Law

, December requires each Federal agency to establish a policy under which eligible em- ployees are authorized to telework. It also provides a statutory deﬁnition for telework; requires a written Telework Agreement between the employee and manager as a condition for participation in telework; and requires every to incorporate telework into their COOP plans. (

) It is the practice of the IRS to provide employees with the opportunity to ticipate in telework when practical and consistent with the IRS mission. Telework should be offered broadly and equitably to employees and their managers contingent on meeting eligibility standards. Use of the IRS Program is encouraged for official duties well suited for completion at an alternate worksite. (

) Telework provides a means of responding to rapidly changing factors today’s Federal government and workforce demographically, socially and nologically. Beneﬁts for telework include: a. Increasing employee productivity and job satisfaction b. Improving work-life balance c. Enhancing recruitment and retention, especially in critical occupations positions d. Improving ability to continue IRS work in the event of an emergency, including but not limited to inclement weather events e. Decreasing the use of excused absence (administrative leave) by telework-ready employees during emergencies f. Providing opportunity for reduced IRS rent, space, and transportation costs g. Providing expanded options for reasonable accommodation h. Supporting environmental sustainability
